section.title: What do I Need?
section.para: Description of the structure of our packages: Stratego/XT and language specific extensions (such as JavaFront).

section.title: Examples
section.para: All the code examples in this manual are available for separate download, such that you can experiment based on these.

section.title: Instructions
section.para: First of all download the required packages (.tar.gz, RPMs or Source RPMs). You need aterm and sdf2-bundle. The URLs are specified in the the release page of StrategoXT.

section.title: Installation of aterm and sdf2-bundle
section.para: The following sequence of commands takes care of building and installing the aterm and the sdf2-bundle in /usr/local.
section.screen:
tar zxf aterm-version.tar.gz cd aterm-version ./configure --with-gcc make make install cd ..
tar zxf sdf2-bundle-version.tar.gz cd sdf2-bundle-version ./configure make make install cd ..
section.para: Configuring the aterm library --with-gcc limits the number of different aterm libraries that are installed. Just installing the gcc version makes installation of the aterm library more portable and is sufficient for StrategoXT.
